question:
If you 
worked at Goldman Sachs this past summer it’s not hard to convince them 
you’re serious about finance – but what if you didn’t?

What if you’re making a 
career transition or you’re coming in as a more experienced hire?
Can you give examples of major line items on each of the financial statements?
How do the 3 statements link together?

If I were stranded on a desert island, only had 1 statement and I wanted to review 
the overall health of a company – which statement would I use and why?

Let’s say I could only look at 2 statements to assess a company’s prospects – which 2 
would I use and why?
If Depreciation is a non-cash expense, why does it affect the cash balance?
Where does Depreciation usually show up on the Income Statement?
What happens when Accrued Compensation goes up by $10?
What happens when Inventory goes up by $10, assuming you pay for it with cash?
Why is the Income Statement not affected by changes in Inventory?

How are all 
3 statements affected at the start of “Year 1,” before anything else happens?
What happens?

They order the inventory, but they 
have not manufactured or sold anything yet – what happens to the 3 statements?
Could you ever end up with negative shareholders’ equity?
What does it mean?
What is Working Capital?
How is it used?
What does negative Working Capital mean?
Is that a bad sign?
First, confirm what type of “bailout” this is – Debt?
Equity?
A combination?
When would a company collect cash from a customer and not record it as revenue?
If cash collected is not recorded as revenue, what happens to it?
What’s the difference between accounts receivable and deferred revenue?

How long does it usually take for a company to collect its accounts receivable 
balance?
What’s the difference between cash-based and accrual accounting?

What would this look like 
under cash-based vs. accrual accounting?
How do you decide when to capitalize rather than expense a purchase?
Why do companies report both GAAP and non-GAAP (or “Pro Forma”) earnings?
How could this happen?

Normally Goodwill remains constant on the Balance Sheet – why would it be 
impaired and what does Goodwill Impairment mean?
Under what circumstances would Goodwill increase?
What’s the difference between LIFO and FIFO?

Can you walk me through an 
example of how they differ?
How is GAAP accounting different from tax accounting?
What are deferred tax assets/liabilities and how do they arise?

Let’s say we’re trying to create these models but don’t have enough information or 
the company doesn’t tell us enough in its filings – what do we do?
What is the Statement of Shareholders’ Equity and why do we use it?

What are examples of non-recurring charges we need to add back to a company’s 
EBIT / EBITDA when looking at its financial statements?

How do you project Balance Sheet items like Accounts Receivable and Accrued 
Expenses in a 3-statement model?
How should you project Depreciation and Capital Expenditures?
How do Net Operating Losses (NOLs) affect a company’s 3 statements?
What’s the difference between capital leases and operating leases?

Why would the Depreciation & Amortization number on the Income Statement be 
different from what’s on the Cash Flow Statement?
Why do we look at both Enterprise Value and Equity Value?

When looking at an acquisition of a company, do you pay more attention to 
Enterprise or Equity Value?
What’s the formula for Enterprise Value?
Why do you need to add the Noncontrolling Interest to Enterprise Value?
How do you calculate fully diluted shares?

It also 
has 10 options outstanding at an exercise price of $5 each – what is its fully diluted 
equity value?

It also 
has 10 options outstanding at an exercise price of $15 each – what is its fully diluted 
equity value?
Why do you subtract cash in the formula for Enterprise Value?

Is that always 
accurate?
Is it always accurate to add Debt to Equity Value when calculating Enterprise Value?
Could a company have a negative Enterprise Value?
What would that mean?
Could a company have a negative Equity Value?
What would that mean?
Why do we add Preferred Stock to get to Enterprise Value?
How do you account for convertible bonds in the Enterprise Value formula?
How do I calculate diluted shares outstanding?
What’s the difference between Equity Value and Shareholders’ Equity?
Are there any problems with the Enterprise Value formula you just gave me?

Should you use the book value or market value of each item when calculating 
Enterprise Value?
What are the 3 major valuation methodologies?
When would you not use a DCF in a Valuation?
What other Valuation methodologies are there?
When would you use a Liquidation Valuation?
When would you use Sum of the Parts?
When do you use an LBO Analysis as part of your Valuation?
What are the most common multiples used in Valuation?
What are some examples of industry-specific multiples?

When you’re looking at an industry-specific multiple like EV / Scientists or EV / 
Subscribers, why do you use Enterprise Value rather than Equity Value?
Would an LBO or DCF give a higher valuation?

How would you present these Valuation methodologies to a company or its 
investors?
How would you value an apple tree?

Why can’t you use Equity Value / EBITDA as a multiple rather than Enterprise 
Value / EBITDA?
When would a Liquidation Valuation produce the highest value?
How would you value it?

What would you use in conjunction with Free Cash Flow multiples – Equity Value 
or Enterprise Value?

You never use Equity Value / EBITDA, but are there any cases where you might 
use Equity Value / Revenue?
How do you select Comparable Companies / Precedent Transactions?

How do you apply the 3 valuation methodologies to actually get a value for the 
company you’re looking at?
What do you actually use a valuation for?

Why would a company with similar growth and profitability to its Comparable 
Companies be valued at a premium?
What are the flaws with public company comparables?
How do you take into account a company’s competitive advantage in a valuation?

Do you ALWAYS use the median multiple of a set of public company comparables 
or precedent transactions?

You mentioned that Precedent Transactions usually produce a higher value than 
Comparable Companies – can you think of a situation where this is not the case?
What are some flaws with precedent transactions?

Two companies have the exact same financial profiles and are bought by the same 
acquirer, but the EBITDA multiple for one transaction is twice the multiple of the 
other transaction – how could this happen?
Why does Warren Buffett prefer EBIT multiples to EBITDA multiples?
What’s the difference between them, and when do you use each one?

If you were buying a vending machine business, would you pay a higher multiple 
for a business where you owned the machines and they depreciated normally, or one 
in which you leased the machines?
How do you value a private company?

Why might we discount the public 
company comparable multiples but not the precedent transaction multiples?
Can you use private companies as part of your valuation?

How do you value banks and financial institutions differently from other 
companies?
What’s the difference in how we select them?
How do you value Net Operating Losses and take them into account in a valuation?
How do I select which report to use?

I have a set of precedent transactions but I’m missing information like EBITDA 
for a lot of the companies – how can I find it if it’s not available via public sources?

How far back and forward do we usually go for public company comparable and 
precedent transaction multiples?

What’s the 
problem with comparing these two valuations directly?

What’s an alternate way to calculate Free Cash Flow aside from taking Net Income, 
adding back Depreciation, and subtracting Changes in Operating Assets / Liabilities 
and CapEx?
Why do you use 5 or 10 years for DCF projections?
What do you usually use for the discount rate?
How do you calculate WACC?
How do you calculate the Cost of Equity?
How do you get to Beta in the Cost of Equity calculation?
Why do you have to un-lever and re-lever Beta?

Would you expect a manufacturing company or a technology company to have a 
higher Beta?

Let’s say that you use Levered Free Cash Flow rather than Unlevered Free Cash 
Flow in your DCF – what is the effect?
If you use Levered Free Cash Flow, what should you use as the Discount Rate?
How do you calculate the Terminal Value?

Why would you use Gordon Growth rather than the Multiples Method to calculate 
the Terminal Value?
What’s an appropriate growth rate to use when calculating the Terminal Value?
How do you select the appropriate exit multiple when calculating Terminal Value?
Which method of calculating Terminal Value will give you a higher valuation?

What’s the flaw with basing terminal multiples on what public company 
comparables are trading at?
How do you know if your DCF is too dependent on future assumptions?

Should Cost of Equity be higher for a $5 billion or $500 million market cap 
company?
What about WACC – will it be higher for a $5 billion or $500 million company?
What’s the relationship between debt and Cost of Equity?

Cost of Equity tells us what kind of return an equity investor can expect for 
investing in a given company – but what about dividends?

Shouldn’t we factor 
dividend yield into the formula?
How can we calculate Cost of Equity WITHOUT using CAPM?

Two companies are exactly the same, but one has debt and one does not – which 
one will have the higher WACC?
Why?

Which has a greater impact on a company’s DCF valuation – a 10% change in 
revenue or a 1% change in the discount rate?
What about a 1% change in revenue vs. a 1% change in the discount rate?
How do you calculate WACC for a private company?

What should you do if you don’t believe management’s projections for a DCF 
model?
Why would you not use a DCF for a bank or other financial institution?
What types of sensitivity analyses would we look at in a DCF?
How do you account for this in a DCF?
Q4 of Year 1 – in my DCF?

How does the terminal value calculation change when we use the mid-year 
convention?

If I’m working with a public company in a DCF, how do I calculate its per-share 
value?

Do 
you count this as debt when calculating Levered Beta for the company?

How would we change the DCF to 
account for the factory purchase, and what would our new Enterprise Value be?
One thing that’s not important?
What’s the difference between a merger and an acquisition?
Why would a company want to acquire another company?
Why would an acquisition be dilutive?

Is there a rule of thumb for calculating whether an acquisition will be accretive or 
dilutive?

A company with a higher P/E acquires one with a lower P/E – is this accretive or 
dilutive?

What is the rule of thumb for assessing whether an M&A deal will be accretive or 
dilutive?
What are the complete effects of an acquisition?

If a company were capable of paying 100% in cash for another company, why 
would it choose NOT to do so?

Why would a strategic acquirer typically be willing to pay more for a company 
than a private equity firm would?
Why do Goodwill & Other Intangibles get created in an acquisition?
What is the difference between Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets?

Is there anything else “intangible” besides Goodwill & Other Intangibles that 
could also impact the combined company?
What are synergies, and can you provide a few examples?
How are synergies used in merger models?
Are revenue or cost synergies more important?

All else being equal, which method would a company prefer to use when acquiring 
another company – cash, stock, or debt?
Why?

• 
It’s hard to compare the “cost” directly to stock, but in general stock is the most 
“expensive” way to finance a transaction – remember how the Cost of Equity is 
almost always higher than the Cost of Debt?
How much debt could a company issue in a merger or acquisition?
How do you determine the Purchase Price for the target company in an acquisition?

Let’s say a company overpays for another company – what typically happens 
afterwards and can you give any recent examples?
What happens?
Why do most mergers and acquisitions fail?
What role does a merger model play in deal negotiations?
What types of sensitivities would you look at in a merger model?

What variables 
would you look at?

What’s the difference between Purchase Accounting and Pooling Accounting in an 
M&A deal?
How do you take into account NOLs in an M&A deal?

Why do deferred tax liabilities (DTLs) and deferred tax assets (DTAs) get created in 
M&A deals?
How do DTLs and DTAs affect the Balance Sheet Adjustment in an M&A deal?
Could you get DTLs or DTAs in an asset purchase?
How do you account for DTLs in forward projections in a merger model?

What’s a Section 338(h)(10) election and why might a company want to use it in an 
M&A deal?
What is an exchange ratio and when would companies use it in an M&A deal?

• 
Form of Consideration: Cash, Stock, Debt… 
• 
Transaction Structure: Stock, Asset, or 338(h)(10) 
• 
Treatment of Options: Assumed by the buyer?
Cashed out?
Ignored?

• 
Employee Retention: Do employees have to sign non-solicit or non-compete 
agreements?
What about management?

• 
Reps & Warranties: What must the buyer and seller claim is true about their 
respective businesses?

• 
No-Shop / Go-Shop: Can the seller “shop” this offer around and try to get a 
better deal, or must it stay exclusive to this buyer?
What’s an Earnout and why would a buyer offer it to a seller in an M&A deal?
How would an accretion / dilution model be different for a private seller?

How would I calculate “break-even synergies” in an M&A deal and what does the 
number mean?

But let’s say I want to combine all 3 financial 
statements – how would I do this?

How do you handle options, convertible debt, and other dilutive securities in a 
merger model?

What are the main 3 transaction structures you could use to acquire another 
company?
Would a seller prefer a stock purchase or an asset purchase?
What about the buyer?

How do you account for transaction costs, financing fees, and miscellaneous 
expenses in a merger model?
Why would you use leverage when buying a company?
What variables impact an LBO model the most?
How do you pick purchase multiples and exit multiples in an LBO model?
What is an “ideal” candidate for an LBO?

How do you use an LBO model to value a company, and why do we sometimes say 
that it sets the “floor valuation” for the company?
Can you explain how the Balance Sheet is adjusted in an LBO model?
Why are Goodwill & Other Intangibles created in an LBO?

We saw that a strategic acquirer will usually prefer to pay for another company in 
cash – if that’s the case, why would a PE firm want to use debt in an LBO?
Do you need to project all 3 statements in an LBO model?
Are there any shortcuts?

How would you determine how much debt can be raised in an LBO and how 
many tranches there would be?
What are reasonable leverage and coverage ratios?
What is the difference between bank debt and high-yield debt?
Why might you use bank debt rather than high-yield debt in an LBO?
Why would a PE firm prefer high-yield debt instead?

Why would a private equity firm buy a company in a “risky” industry, such as 
technology?
How could a private equity firm boost its return in an LBO?
What is meant by the “tax shield” in an LBO?
What is a dividend recapitalization (“dividend recap”)?

Why would a PE firm choose to do a dividend recap of one of its portfolio 
companies?
How would a dividend recap impact the 3 financial statements in an LBO?

Call Protection: Is the company prohibited from “calling back” – paying off or 
redeeming – the security for a certain period?
How would an asset write-up or write-down affect an LBO model?

Normally we care about the IRR for the equity investors in an LBO – the PE firm 
that buys the company – but how do we calculate the IRR for the debt investors?

Why might a private equity firm allot some of a company’s new equity in an LBO to 
a management option pool, and how would this affect the model?

Why you would you use PIK (Payment In Kind) debt rather than other types of 
debt, and how does it affect the debt schedules and the other statements?
What are some examples of incurrence covenants?
Maintenance covenants?
Can you also use Section 338(h)(10) election?
How would you adjust the Income Statement in an LBO model?

In an LBO model, is it possible for debt investors to get a higher return than the PE 
firm?
What does it tell us about the company we’re modeling?

How fast should the 
driver drive to travel the same 60 miles in the same time period, but at an average of 
60 miles per hour?
What is the angle formed by the hands of the clock when it is 1:45?

What is the greatest dollar value in coins you can have in your hands 
without being able to make change for a dollar?

How do you get 
exactly 4 liters of water?
